intro: Rubus iodes f. laxus, commonly known as the loose-stemmed raspberry. This is a flowering plant in the Rosaceae family, characterized by its thorny stems and aggregate fruits. It typically grows in open woodlands and disturbed areas, preferring well-drained soils. The plant produces white to pale yellow flowers in the spring, followed by edible red berries in the summer. Its foliage is usually compound, with serrated leaflets and a distinctive, aromatic scent.
